result.execSummary:
The defendant Codi J. OLSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Intoxicated Use of Vehicle, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay restitution of $6,459.76 to the victim's family, Larry and Patricia Waterman, 503 Jackson Street, P.O. Box 6, Mishicot, WI  54228 and hold open the matter for any additional counseling bills.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

No entry into any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  

Defendant is to keep a picture of the victim in his cell if it is provided by the victim's family and with their approval.

When on extended supervision perform forty (40) hours of community service per year by speaking to victim impact panels or school groups regarding the impact this has had on his life and his families life.  

Every year while on extended supervision on 02-16-15 he is to visit the gravesite of the victim with the consent of the victim's family.  

Provide DNA sample.
WRITE A LETTER OF APOLOGY TO THE FAMILY OF DEREK WATERMAN

records.addlTxt:
Order Denying Defendant's Motion.
It is hereby ordered that the defendant's motion to modify sentence is hereby vacated.

MOTION TO MODIFY SENTENCE - 
Defendant in custody on WRIT.
Attorney Bilka argues the motion.
The State opposes the motion to modify sentence.  The defendant has not met the new factor standard.
The Court has reviewed the defendant's motion very closely.  The Court doesnt find any clear and convincing evidence to show that a new factor exists.  Also, the motion was not timely filed but the court does not base its decision on that.  
The Court denies the motion to modify sentence.
State to draft order.

Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum and Order to Sheriff to transport defendant for Motion Hearing on 11-06-17 at 11:00 a.m.   
Copy filed.

The defendant has filed a motion to modify sentence, pro se.
The Court questions the defendant about his right to an attorney for this matter.  The defendant states he wishes to proceed without one at this time.
The Court explains to the defendant his right to an attorney and finds that he has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived that right.
Motion hearing is set for 11-06-17 at 11:00 a.m.  The court advises the defendant that he will be contacted the same way he was today.
If the State wishes to file anything in writing, it is to be filed by 10-31-17.

Notice of Motion Hearing and Motion for Modification of Bail Conditions.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-03-14 at 2:00 p.m.  
Minutes.
John Bilka, through Public Defender.
RE:  Derek Waterman, on 02-16-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of operate while suspended-causing death and homicide by intoxicated use of motor vehicle.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-24-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release, that he report daily to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department, by 5:00 p.m., that he not operate a motor vehicle and that he maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
